AIRED.Definition: given time on television or radio

ANCHOR.Definition: a person who is the main news reader on a television or radio news programme

BOYCOTT.Definition: to refuse to buy a product or take part in an activity as a way of expressing strong disapproval

BUTTONS TO PRESS.Definition: ways to encourage a particular feeling

CABLE.Definition: the system of sending television programmes or phone signals along wires under the ground

CANDIDACY.Definition: the fact of being a candidate in an election

CLIPS.Definition: a short part of a film or television programme

COMPLIMENTING.Definition: a remark that expresses approval, admiration, or respect

CONGLOMERATE.Definition: a company that owns several smaller businesses whose products or services are usually very different

CONSERVATIVE.Definition: tending to emphasise the importance of preserving traditional cultural and religious values, and to oppose change, esp. sudden change

CONTROVERSY.Definition: a lot of disagreement or argument about something, usually because it affects or is important to many people

COSY.Definition: comfortable and pleasant, especially (of a building) because of being small and warm

COUNTLESS.Definition: very many, or too many to be counted

DEFAULT.Definition: the thing that exists or happens if you do not change it intentionally by performing an action

DID FOR.Definition: to seriously damage something, or to seriously hurt or kill someone

DOWNFALL.Definition: (something that causes) the usually sudden destruction of a person, organisation, or government and their loss of power, money, or health

DOWNPLAYED.Definition: made to seem less important than it should be

DUBIOUS.Definition: thought not to be completely true or not able to be trusted

ERA.Definition: a period of time of which particular events or stages of development are typical

FAST AND LOOSE.Definition: to treat something or someone without enough care

FEE.Definition: an amount of money paid for a particular piece of work or for a particular right or service

FEES.Definition: an amount of money paid for a particular piece of work or for a particular right or service

HANDLING.Definition: the way that someone deals with a situation or person

HANG ON.Definition: to wait for a short time

HOAX.Definition: a plan to deceive someone, such as telling the police there is a bomb somewhere when there is not one, or a trick

HOSTAGE.Definition: someone who is taken as a prisoner by an enemy in order to force the other people involved to do what the enemy wants

HOSTAGES.Definition: someone who is taken as a prisoner by an enemy in order to force the other people involved to do what the enemy wants

IDYLLIC.Definition: An idyllic place or experience is extremely pleasant, beautiful, or peaceful

IGNITE.Definition: to (cause to) start burning or explode, to feel strongly about something

IMPEACH.Definition: to make a formal statement saying that a public official is guilty of a serious offence in connection with their job, especially in the US

IRONIC.Definition: interesting, strange, or funny because of being very different from what you would usually expect

LAWSUIT.Definition: a problem taken to a law court by an ordinary person or an organisation rather than the police in order to obtain a legal decision

LIABLE.Definition: having (legal) responsibility for something or someone

MARMITE.Definition: a brand name for a type of soft, dark brown, salty-tasting food for spreading on bread, made from yeast, that is popular in the UK. If something is referred to as 'Marmite', it means that it divides opinion

MEDIAN.Definition: The median value is the middle one in a set of values arranged in order of size

MINIMISED.Definition: to reduce something to the least possible level or amount

MOGUL.Definition: an important person who is very rich or powerful

OBSESSION.Definition: something or someone that you think about all the time

OUTSIDER.Definition: a person who is not involved with a particular group of people or organisation or who does not live in a particular place

OUTSPOKEN.Definition: expressing strong opinions very directly without worrying if other people are offended

PETITIONS.Definition: a document signed by a large number of people demanding or asking for some action from the government or another authority

PRIME TIME.Definition: in television and radio broadcasting, the time when the largest number of people are watching or listening

PROFITABLE.Definition: making or likely to make a profit

REITERATE.Definition: to say something again, once or several times

RESONATES.Definition: If an experience or memory resonates, it makes you think of another similar one

REVENUE.Definition: the income that a government or company receives regularly

SHY AWAY.Definition: to avoid something that you dislike, fear, or do not feel confident about

STREAM.Definition: a continuous flow of things or people

TEND.Definition: to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic

UNDERDOG.Definition: a person or group of people with less power, money, etc. than the rest of society

UNDERREPRESENTED.Definition: If a type of person or thing is underrepresented in a group or organisation, there are not enough of them in it:

UNDOING.Definition: the cause of someone's failure, or of someone's loss of power or money

UNITES.Definition: to join together as a group, or to make people join together as a group; to combine
